metadata.commander_name: Generalmajor Georg von Bismarck (KIA 31 August 1942), then Generalmajor Heinz von Randow (18 September 1942 - 21 December 1942)

narrative.title: 21 Panzer Division - 1942Q4
narrative.situation: German Panzer Division (Africa) deployed in North Africa during 1942Q4.
narrative.objectives: Mobile armored warfare and combined-arms operations. By Q4 1942, forced into static defensive role at El Alamein due to fuel shortages.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain and rocky desert at El Alamein defensive positions. Mix of hard-packed gravel plains, soft sand areas, and coastal salt marshes (impassable to vehicles).

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Desert warfare experience (since February 1941 in North Africa)
Rapid maneuver and exploitation (when fuel available)
Anti-tank defense in depth using PaK guns and hull-down tanks

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain and rocky desert at El Alamein defensive positions. Mix of hard-packed gravel plains, soft sand areas, and coastal salt marshes (impassable to vehicles).
